column3: A “style” of acting so different - sometimes cinematic, sometimes commedia dell’arte with masks, sometimes slapstick comedy, sometimes dealing with the tragic human condition .... always riveting.

My son, twelve, but with the mind of a thirty year old, wife, and myself were blown away! The adaptation was so true to the novel that the stylization of the direction and the actors performances only enhanced Orwell’s themes and messages! The intimacy of the theater and the actors being surrounded by the ever watchful eyes of the audience drove all points home. My family and I say thank you for a wonderful life experience, one that is so poignant and needed now!

The 1984’s message being relevant in our times today more than ever. I loved that I finally got to see the beautiful Actors Gang theatre and Tim Robbins live in such an intimate setting to boot! What a rare treat for theatre lovers of Los Angeles.

I have seen several shows at The Actors' Gang and they have all been terrific. The performers seem to give their all to every performance. I don't know how they do it! 1984 is no exception. The cast is all in and Tim Robbins' performance adds another level of super creepiness to Big Brother even though you hear only his voice in the first half. Love the theater too. Make the effort to check it out.

column2: So Proud of my Son, Tom Szymanski
column3: My wife Moni n I surprised my Son, n flew to LA to see the Riveting performance of 1984, at The Actors Gang Theater, in Culver City.Directed marvelously by Tim Robbins, and performed by a very powerful Cast. Great job, AGT
Best actors and plays. Great discovery for my husband and I. Love the space, the location and the people.

Set in the round, with actors supervised and responding to white screens, 1984 packs a wallop. Well directed, and acted. Winston Smith is a believable everyman and the chorus of citizens frequent devolution into simultaneous cacophony is very uncomfortable. An unsettling play; walking out of the theater di not bring relief.
